OM_Karlach_COM.synopsis: Karlach interacts with her parents tombstones. Throughout this convo she speaks with meaning, but doesn't get too emotional. Tenderness without a lot of sadness. She's had a long time to come to terms with the loss of her parents - this is more of a homecoming.
OM_Karlach_COM.how_to_trigger: 1. Load CTY_Main_A.2. Have Karlach in your party.3. goto 5; 39; 314. Interact with any of the two revealed tombstones.

PAD_SpottedParentsGraves.how_to_trigger: 1. Load CTY_Main_A2. Have Karlach in the party.3. goto 2; 41; 30

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM.synopsis: Karlach interacts with her parents tombstones.
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: 1. Load CTY_Main_A.2. Have Karlach in your party.3. goto 5; 39; 314. Interact with any of the two revealed tombstones.

OM_Karlach_COM_18.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_18.text: Here lie Pluck and Caerlack Cliffgate. My parents. Hi mum. Hi dad.
OM_Karlach_COM_18.context:
NodeContext: Warmly and with feeling, but not cracking/ tearing up
Caerlack = Karlach (spelled different, same sound)

OM_Karlach_COM_26.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_26.text: Sorry I haven't visited. I've been... away. But I'm back now! And I brought friends.

OM_Karlach_COM_1.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_1.text: I miss you so much. But I'm happy. And getting up to some really important shit. Maybe you can see for yourselves. I don't know.
OM_Karlach_COM_1.context: NodeContext: Maybe looks up here, thinking about being watched by her folks from the afterlife.

OM_Karlach_COM_5.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_5.text: You're with me here, anyway. Taters.
OM_Karlach_COM_5.context:
NodeContext: 'Here' is in her heart.
In this moment 'Taters' means 'I love you' between Karlach and her family, which she is about to explain.

OM_Karlach_COM_17.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_17.text: Meant 'I love you' in the Cliffgate household. I can't even remember how it started anymore. Lost family lore.

OM_Karlach_COM_11.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_11.text: There was a lot of silly nonsense in our house. My mates used to say we had our own personal language. I guess I'm the last remaining speaker.

OM_Karlach_COM_4.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_4.text: Me too. Didn't realise how nice it'd feel to come say hello.

OM_Karlach_COM_10.speaker: Player
OM_Karlach_COM_10.text: May I ask how your parents died?

OM_Karlach_COM_12.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_12.text: I was a teenager when mum passed - bad fever. A good healer could've saved her, but she slipped away before we found one who'd take our gold.

OM_Karlach_COM_15.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_15.text: Dad went a few years later. He was on an errand for work, travelling the Risen Road. His cart overturned and caught him just so.

OM_Karlach_COM_6.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_6.text: I was on my own after that. Fell in with Gortash not long after. If my folks had been alive, they would've sniffed him out straight away.

OM_Karlach_COM_0.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_0.context: NodeContext: Like a shrug. Not blaming them/ getting too down about it. It is what it is.

OM_Karlach_COM_14.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_14.text: Mum used to say there was no such thing as death. That there was only change.

OM_Karlach_COM_20.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_20.text: Dad thought that was a load of woo. That gone meant gone, unless you'd struck a deal with one of the gods. Said he had better things to do in life than beg favours off immortals.

OM_Karlach_COM_22.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_22.text: I'm not sure what I believe.

OM_Karlach_COM_3.speaker: Player
OM_Karlach_COM_3.text: It's the ultimate mystery. There are many possibilities, but we'll never know until we get there.

OM_Karlach_COM_16.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_16.text: Something to look forward to. Bit morbid, but true all the same.

OM_Karlach_COM_21.speaker: Player
OM_Karlach_COM_21.text: Your mum was right. Our bodies become soil, water, air. We don't die, we just change.

OM_Karlach_COM_23.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_23.text: Nice thought, isn't it? This grass could be my mum's hair. The air in my lungs might be my dad telling me 'taters'. I like that.

OM_Karlach_COM_7.speaker: Player
OM_Karlach_COM_7.text: I agree with your dad. Death is the end of life - it's harsh, but true.

OM_Karlach_COM_25.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_25.text: Classic Pluck Cliffgate. Harsh but honest. He may be right - but then again, he may not. Only one way to find out, huh?

OM_Karlach_COM_13.speaker: Player
OM_Karlach_COM_13.text: There is no need to wonder. Our souls travel to the City of Judgement and are then taken by the gods.

OM_Karlach_COM_28.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_28.text: If they deign to choose us. There's no guarantee, is there? And I've made little effort to attract the loyalty of anyone but you.

OM_Karlach_COM_19.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_COM_19.text: Hopefully there's more waiting for me than that. Very hopefully.

PAD_SpottedParentsGraves_0.speaker: Karlach
PAD_SpottedParentsGraves_0.text: Hey, my folks are buried here. I'd love to pay them a visit.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_40.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_40.text: Here lie Pluck and Caerlack Cliffgate. Hi mum. Hi dad.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_25.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_25.text: Sorry I haven't visited. I've been... away. But I'm back now.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_39.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_39.text: I miss you so much. But I'm happy. And getting up to some really important shit. Maybe you can see for yourselves. I don't know.
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_39.context: NodeContext: Maybe looks up here, thinking about being watched by her folks from the afterlife.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_6.text: You're with me here, anyway. Taters.
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_6.context:
NodeContext: 'Here' is in her heart.
In this moment 'Taters' means 'I love you' between Karlach and her family, which she is about to explain.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_17.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_17.text: I can't even remember how that started. It's always been how we said 'I love you'.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_0.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_0.text: A whole private language, just for us. Just me, now.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_1.text: Mum, you used to say there was no such thing as death. Only change.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_11.text: Dad thought that was a load of woo. That gone meant gone, unless you'd struck a deal with one of the gods. But you had better things to do than beg favours off immortals, right, dad?

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_34.text: I don't know what I think.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_33.text: Nothing to do but cross that bridge when I get there.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_12.text: Something to look forward to - an answer to the greatest mystery of all. Bit morbid, but true all the same.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_9.text: Mum was onto something. How can we die when we become the grass?

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_21.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_21.text: Dad had it right. Once it's lights out, it's lights out.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_2.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_2.text: In an instant. Tough but only maybe right. Just like dad.
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_2.context: NodeContext: With humor. She loves her dad.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_26.text: Wish me luck, mum and dad. I need it.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_29.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_29.text: What about the City of Judgement and the gods and all that?

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_18.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_18.text: You'd have to worship the gods to get picked up by 'em. The rest of us just fade away, or so they say.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_36.text: Let's hope they've got it wrong.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_23.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_23.text: What I wouldn't give for another hour together. Another minute.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_20.text: Mum would've lived if we'd found a good enough healer who'd take our gold. Greedy bastards.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_19.text: As for dad... bad luck, I guess. But they should've found someone younger to take the job on the Risen Road. Maybe someone with a better back could've dodged the cart in time...

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_32.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_32.text: If, if, if. If and but. But and how. And most of all, why.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_24.text: I never would've bothered with Gortash if they'd been around. They wouldn't have let me within a league of him.

OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Karlach
OM_Karlach_AOM_OOM_8.context: NodeContext: Like a shrug. Not blaming them/ getting too down about it. It is what it is.
